intro: Rhododendron ferrugineum album, commonly known as the alpine azalea, is a low-growing shrub native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. It is adapted to cold climates and can withstand harsh environmental conditions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is a notable species in high-altitude flora.
